content.rendered:
The bottle which recently broke the world record for the highest amount paid at auction for a bottle of Japanese Single Malt Whisky, when it sold for $343,000 at Bonhams in August but as global collectors we have the best prices in the market. After more than a half century of aging, a mere 150 bottles of this expression are released each year. As the number of collectors seeking these high end bottles continues to grow, they have become increasingly scarce. Among the few that have had the pleasure of tasting this prolific Japanese Whisky, it is described as a once in a lifetime experience, which offers complex flavors that cannot be compared to anything else.

Presented in a special wooden box, this Yamazaki 50 Year Old is exceptional. Owning a bottle will instantly move any collection into the ranks of the worlds most elite.

excerpt.rendered:
Distillery: Yamazaki
Age: 50 Years
Whisky Origin: Japanese
Single Malt: Yes
Alcohol Strength: 53%
Bottle Size: 70cl
Weight: 3 Kg
